Description: Body fragment of North Ionian Wild Goat style pottery bowl. Inside glazed with one added red band lined in white preserved; exterior: part of preening duck to right and varied filling ornament; glazed below.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the National Museum of Scotland. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.170)
CVA Edinburgh / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum National Museums of Scotland Edinburgh (p. 4, pl. 3, 18)
